author: Special Correspondent
text:
Responding to the invitation from the DMDK that like-minded parties could approach it for alliance talks, BJP State president Tamilisai Soundararajan, on Friday, said all those wanting to dethrone the two Dravidian majors should work together in the spirit of “equality”.

Speaking to The Hindu , Ms. Tamilisai said there could not be space for terms like “under” and “over” to work with when there was a common goal to achieve.

“We believe there should be a spirit of equality. The aim of ridding the State of the two Dravidian parties cannot happen if each function like an island,” she opined, when asked if the BJP was willing to be a junior partner of DMDK.

DMDK panel meets

Meanwhile, DMDK sources said its president Vijayakant held an hour-long meeting with the seven-member committee formed to identify candidates for the upcoming Assembly spolls at the party headquarters in Koyambedu.
title: Let’s work as equals to defeat Dravidian majors: Tamilisai
